intro: Hedlundia mougeotii, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Hedlundia mougeotii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
